content: panorama stole designed by kate lore for emerald lotus fiberarts this is a pattern for a long stole gently increasing outward it s an easy pattern to do and is adaptable to any weight of yarn to get the gentle shaping you will be increasing one stitch at each end on each row two stitches increased on each row what you do between those increases is up to you but i ve written out a pattern for eyelets and ridges shown in the sample photo the sample is knit in handspun yarn which adds another level of fun to the project knit at a looser gauge it will drape softly over your shoulders and around your neck the finished size of this sample stole is 61 by 12 yarn dk or worsted weight approximately 250 to 350 yards needles size 8us 5 0mm - 32 circular needles or size of needle to get gauge gauge in stockinette stitch 14sts = 4 abbreviatons kfb - knit into the front and back of the stitch this is an increase stitch k2tog knit 2 together yo - yarn over k - knit p - purl copyright © 2015 emerald lotus fiberarts this pattern is offered free for personal use only and is not to be sold please contact us if you have any questions or problems with the pattern elfiberarts@gmail com panorama stole designed by kate lore for emerald lotus fiberarts cast on 3 stitches you should always have an odd number of stitches on your needles for the eyelet row to work out correctly *** set up row row 1 kfb k1 kfb row 2 kfb knit to last stitch kfb repeat the last row 8 more times *** stockinette pattern row 11 kfb knit to last stitch kfb row 12 kfb purl to last stitch kfb row 13 kfb knit to last stitch kfb row 14 kfb purl to last stitch kfb *** eyelet pattern row 15 kfb knit to last stitch kfb row 16 kfb knit to last stitch kfb row 17 kfb *k2tog yo* repeat between * * to last 2 stitches k1 kfb row 18 kfb knit to last stitch kfb *** stockinette pattern row 19 kfb knit to last stitch kfb row 20 kfb purl to last stitch kfb row 21 kfb knit to last stitch kfb row 22 kfb purl to last stitch kfb *** garter stitch pattern row 23 - 32 kfb knit to last stitch kfb repeat row 11 - 32 three to four times depending on how much yarn you have you will want to finish the shawl with the 10-row garter stitch pattern bind off loosely blocking the stole will open up the eyelets for the sample i repeated row 11-32 three times because i didn t have enough yarn to do another full repeat of row 11-32 and i wanted to use up all my remaining yarn i just kept knitting the garter stitch pattern and knit 20 row instead of
